name: Quality Inn Foristell

reviews.text: This is right on the freeway and hence decided to spend a night during a roadtrip. The hotel is OK for the money we paid. The breakfast isnt that good and rooms are OK. Due to smoking ground floor, the smoke gets to the upper level non-smoking rooms and was irritating.
reviews.title: Worth for overnight stay

reviews.text: Best Western West 70 Inn provides a convenient stop just west of the often congested urban area of St. Louis. It offered well decorated, clean, comfortable rooms at a reasonable price for the overnight stay. The breakfast was the normal fare for these establishments, but I was a bit disappointed that they did not offer milk. Fortunately the Orange Juice was quite good. The front desk people were friendly and helpful. The room was quiet even though I had people on both sides. I had a refrigerator. coffee pot, and microwave in the room. There was a nice outdoor pool for summer use. The only food establishment within walking distance was a truck stop, but they also recommended a few restaurants with delivery. Many restaurants are at exit 208 off of !-70. The hotel had easy access to I-70 and ample parking.
reviews.title: I-70 Gem

reviews.text: Stopped in without a reservation at the Best Western and were checked in to a clean room and a very good rate. Room was big, clean and had newer decor. Breakfast was very nice.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Best Western

reviews.text: This hotel has a great location right off I-70 really close to St. Charles and to the Outlet Mall. The room was nice and clean and the staff were all very helpful with directions and suggestions for what to do in the area. Overall it was a great stay!
reviews.title: Great Best Western

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good value, friendly and helpful staff and easy to find. My wife and I stayed here because we wanted to be out of the St. Louis morning rush hour. It was a good choice. The rooms were large and clean and the King sized bed was comfortable. Breakfast was typical for most hotel chains, it was good, had adequate choices and the convenience of having it ready and waiting is a plus. The only downfall may be the noise of the trucks entering and exiting the truck stop close to the hotel.
reviews.title: It was a good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on the way to Kentucky and on the way home to Kansas. It was a great stay both times. The staff members went beyond the call to make sure we had a room on the first floor since we could not climb stairs. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Very quiet considering it was so close to I-70. Great price and a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great value and friendly staff.

reviews.text: We stopped at this hotel on our way to Kansas City. We thought it would be a nice place to stay because it was just past the city of St. Louis and out of the congested area. Also, the Best Western name is typically good, so we decided to stop here. We were VERY pleased with our decision. The rate was about $85 for four of us and the room was great. There were two queen beds and still plenty of space to move around. In fact, this room was better than the room we paid $115 for in KC. Keep in mind, we were only here to sleep. We did not visit the pool or use any of the hotel's services. We did stop to look at the breakfast before departing. It was VERY basic - muffins, cereal, etc., and there was not a lot of space to sit in their small dining area. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a place to stop during a trip!
reviews.title: Greatly Exceeded Expectations!

reviews.text: After stopping the previous night at a Best Western and feeling we got value for money we gave this one a go as it was listed in the Hotel Coupon book and we weren't disappointed. Nice and clean and breakfast was adequate to keep us going till lunch. Definately worth stopping at if you are on the road with your family.
reviews.title: Value

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised at the nice room we got as we had booked at low-dollar price! We were in town for a wedding & just needed a place to stay. The decor was very updated, the room clean, and all the amenities were provided. The ladies at the desk were very amicable, and the breakfast was not bad for a continental breakfast. (My husband was pleased to find biscuits & gravy!) The only downside was hearing the ice machine a couple times, highway noise, and a couple trains, but it WAS close to the interstate, and that was a plus! We give it a definite "thumbs up"!
reviews.title: Great place to stay !

reviews.text: This was owned by the Choice Hotel group when we had our stay. Good value! Rooms ok Basic breakfast Easy checkin Easy to find Glad we made reservations because the hotel sold out!
reviews.title: Now a Quality Inn

reviews.text: The only negative part of this stay was that there were trucks in and out of the travel center next door, but the convenience of the gas station and restaurants nearby, as well as the decent price made up for this uncontrollable factor. The people who workweek there were amazingly polite and helpful, and the room we stayed in was wonderful - clean and good-sized and absolutely lovely. If I pass through here again, I will definitely be staying here.
reviews.title: Wonderfully convenient and kind.

reviews.text: Overall a great night stay and would stay again. Cozy feeling in lobby, decorated for the holidays. Friendly staff, beds comfy, good continental breakfast. Room could have been cleaner around the edges. Would have liked an exercise room. GREAT location.
reviews.title: 1 night stay - right off I70

reviews.text: Pet friendly is an understatement. The first room smelled of dog so we asked to be moved. The staff apologized and gave us an upstairs room which was better. However, the stairwell to the upstairs stunk of fecis. We were so tired from driving for 14 hrs that we stayed anyway.
reviews.title: Pet Western

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in October because all of the other hotels in the area were sold out due to Oktoberfest. Check in was decent, although they go behind a wall to run your credit card, which seems a bit non-transparent in these days of rampant fraud. The lobby smells a little like smoke and the first floor really smells like smoke. Note that there are non-smoking rooms on the first floor but I would not stay there because the halls smelled like smoke. We stayed on the second floor, which had no evidence of smoke. The room was spacious, but the bathroom was a bit cramped. For example, if one person is at the vanity and the other wants in, the person at the vanity has to move to the back of the bathroom to allow the door to open. Access to the highway is great. Look, there is nothing terrible about this hotel, but there's really not a lot to praise about it either.
reviews.title: Only if you have to

description: Quality Inn located in Foristell, MO Featured in St. Louis as one of the best places to have your wedding and reception in a country atmosphere, the Quality Inn® in Foristell, Missouri is located near the very popular Cedar Lake Cellars Winery. This Foristell, MO hotel is also close to Meadows at Lake St. Louis and Incline Village Golf Club.Guests of the Quality Inn will appreciate the interior corridors that offer easy and safe room access. Guest laundry service is available as is access to copy and fax services. There is one meeting room, with the hotel able to accommodate 45 people for conferences.
